availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Surface (Ohio farmhand and soldier.)

body.p: Ohio, farmhand and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Adam J. Surface and Sarah Irick Surface. Farmhand in Cass County, Indiana, in 1860. Attended school in Cass County in 1860. Served in the 156th Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from May 2, 1864, to September 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Cass County, Tipton Township, p. 594.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Butler County, Oxford Township, p. 365B.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1865, vol. IX (Cincinnati, OH: The Ohio Valley Press, 1889), 241.
"CPL Andrew Jay Surface (1843-1919)," Find A Grave, Memorial 137124576, accessed November 15, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/137124576.
